access_lists.title: IP Extended Access-Lists (legacy model)
access_lists.description:
AVD currently supports 2 different data models for extended ACLs:

- The legacy `access_lists` data model, for compatibility with existing deployments
- The improved `ip_access_lists` data model, for access to more EOS features

Both data models can coexists without conflicts, as different keys are used: `access_lists` vs `ip_access_lists`.
Access list names must be unique.

The legacy data model supports simplified ACL definition with `sequence` to `action` mapping:

action.description:
Action as string
Example: "deny ip any any"
action.title: Action

vlan.description: VLAN value(s) or range(s) of VLAN values
vlan.title: Vlan

cos.description: CoS value(s) or range(s) of CoS values
cos.title: Cos

community_lists.title: Community Lists (legacy model)
community_lists.description:
AVD supports 2 different data models for community lists:

- The legacy `community_lists` data model that can be used for compatibility with the existing deployments.
- The improved `ip_community_lists` data model.

Both data models can coexist without conflicts, as different keys are used: `community_lists` vs `ip_community_lists`.
Community list names must be unique.

The legacy data model supports simplified community list definition that only allows a single action to be defined as string:

exec.description: command to run as a daemon
exec.title: Exec

eos_cli.title: EOS CLI
eos_cli.description: Multiline string with EOS CLI rendered directly on the root level of the final EOS configuration

regex.description: Regular expression to use for searching log messages. Required for on-logging trigger
regex.title: Regex

asynchronous.description: Set the action to be non-blocking.
asynchronous.title: Asynchronous

items.description:
EOS CLI interface command
Example: "switchport mode access"

ip_community_lists.title: IP Community Lists
ip_community_lists.description:
AVD supports 2 different data models for community lists:

- The legacy `community_lists` data model that can be used for compatibility with the existing deployments.
- The improved `ip_community_lists` data model.

Both data models can coexist without conflicts, as different keys are used: `community_lists` vs `ip_community_lists`.
Community list names must be unique.

The improved data model has a better design documented below:

communities and regexp MUST not be configured together in the same entry
possible community strings are (case insensitive):
 - GSHUT
 - internet
 - local-as
 - no-advertise
 - no-export
 - <1-4294967040>
 - aa:nn

communities.description: If defined, a standard community-list will be configured
communities.title: Communities

regexp.title: Regular Expression
regexp.description: If defined, a regex community-list will be configured

proxy.description: Global proxy settings should be enabled before enabling per-vlan
proxy.title: Proxy

action.description:
Action as string
Example: "deny ipv6 any any"
action.title: Action

action.description:
Action as string
Example: "deny ipv6 any any"
action.title: Action

privilege.description: Initial privilege level with local EXEC authorization.
privilege.title: Privilege

role.description: EOS RBAC Role to be assigned to the user such as "network-admin" or "network-operator"
role.title: Role

sha512_password.title: SHA512 Hash of Password
sha512_password.description: Must be the hash of the password. By default EOS salts the password with the username, so the simplest is to generate the hash on an EOS device using the same username.

no_password.description: If set a password will not be configured for this user. "sha512_password" MUST not be defined for this user.
no_password.title: No Password

default_services.description: Enable default services: capi-doc and tapagg
default_services.title: Default Services

certificate.description: Name of certificate; private key must also be specified
certificate.title: Certificate

private_key.description: Name of private key; certificate must also be specified
private_key.title: Private Key

gateway.description: IPv4 address of default gateway in management VRF
gateway.title: Gateway

ipv6_gateway.description: IPv6 address of default gateway in management VRF
ipv6_gateway.title: Ipv6 Gateway

cipher.description: Cryptographic ciphers for SSH to use
cipher.title: Cipher

key_exchange.description: Cryptographic key exchange methods for SSH to use
key_exchange.title: Key Exchange

mac.description: Cryptographic MAC algorithms for SSH to use
mac.title: Mac

limit.description: Maximum total number of SSH sessions to device
limit.title: Limit

per_host.description: Maximum number of SSH sessions to device from a single host
per_host.title: Per Host

match.description:
Match as string
Example: "as-range 1-100 result accept"
match.title: Match

items.description:
Match as string
Example: "ip address prefix-list PL-LOOPBACKS-EVPN-OVERLAY"

action.description:
Action as string
Example: "deny ip any any"
action.title: Action

config.description:
TCAM Profile Config. Since these can be very long, it is often a good idea to import the config from a file.
Example: "{{lookup('file', '{{ root_dir }}/inventory/TCAM_TRAFFIC_POLICY.conf')}}"
config.title: Config
